item.title: Mandie add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "Those who don't believe in magic will never find it." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Mandie add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "It is a curious thought, but it is only when you see people looking ridiculous that you realize just how much you love them. " -- Agatha Christie

item.title: Mandie add a quote by Albert Schweitzer
item.description: "Sometimes our light goes out, but is blown again into instant flame by an encounter with another human being." -- Albert Schweitzer

item.title: Mandie add a quote by Nicole Krauss
item.description: "Once upon a time there was a boy who loved a girl, and her laughter was a question he wanted to spend his whole life answering." -- Nicole Krauss

item.title: Mandie add a quote by Elinor Glyn
item.description: "Romance is the glamour which turns the dust of everyday life into a golden haze. " -- Elinor Glyn

item.title: Mandie add a quote by Paul Klee
item.description: "A single day is enough to make us a little larger or, another time, a little smaller." -- Paul Klee

item.title: Mandie add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "Those who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Mandie add a quote by Rita Mae Brown
item.description: "I think the reward for conformity is that everyone likes you except yourself." -- Rita Mae Brown

item.title: Mandie add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I would always rather be happy than dignified." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Mandie add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description: "To die would be an awfully big adventure." -- J.M. Barrie

item.title: Mandie add a quote by William Blake
item.description: "If a thing loves, it is infinite." -- William Blake

item.title: Mandie add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Double, double, toil and trouble; Fire burn, and cauldron bubble!" -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Mandie add a quote by Henry James
item.description: "Three things in human life are important: the first is to be kind; the second is to be kind; and the third is to be kind." -- Henry James

item.title: Mandie add a quote by John Berger
item.description: "When we read a story, we inhabit it. The covers of the book are like a roof and four walls. What is to happen next will take place within the four walls of the story. And this is possible because the story's voice makes everything its own." -- John Berger

item.title: Mandie add a quote by Betty Smith
item.description: "The world was hers for the reading." -- Betty Smith

item.title: Mandie add a quote by Henry Ward Beecherr
item.description: "Where is human nature so weak as in the bookstore?" -- Henry Ward Beecherr

item.title: Mandie add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Another belief of mine: that everyone else my age is an adult, whereas I am merely in disguise." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Mandie add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "Kiss me, and you will see how important I am." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Mandie add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "Let us be grateful to the people who make us happy; they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Mandie add a quote by Maxim Gorky
item.description: "Happiness always looks small while you hold it in your hands, but let it go, and you learn at once how big and precious it is." -- Maxim Gorky

item.title: Mandie add a quote by Alan Bennett
item.description: "What she was finding also was how one book led to another, doors kept opening wherever she turned and the days weren't long enough for the reading she wanted to do." -- Alan Bennett

item.title: Mandie add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Mandie add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is no friend as loyal as a book." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Mandie add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I cannot live without books." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Mandie add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "A reader lives a thousand lives before he dies, said Jojen. The man who never reads lives only one." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Mandie add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Books are a uniquely portable magic." -- Stephen King

item.title: Mandie add a quote by Diane Duane
item.description: "Reading one book is like eating one potato chip." -- Diane Duane

item.title: Mandie add a quote by Christopher Paolini
item.description: "Books should go where they will be most appreciated, and not sit unread, gathering dust on a forgotten shelf, don't you agree?" -- Christopher Paolini

item.title: Mandie add a quote by Johnny Cash
item.description: "All your life, you will be faced with a choice. You can choose love or hate…I choose love." -- Johnny Cash

item.title: Mandie add a quote by E.Y. Harburg
item.description: "Somewhere over the rainbow, skies are blue, and the dreams that you dare to dream really do come true." -- E.Y. Harburg
